name: Hotel Monaco Portland - A Kimpton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a dreary stay in Portland, the weather wasn't important. The welcoming vibe at the Monaco was warming. The room was cozy, but not too updated. Comfortable beds and lots of amenities were fun. The big bottle of water wasn't a freebie, though, so be careful!!
reviews.title: Such a homey feeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Happy hour was the highlight of our visit. We met such interesting people around the living room setting. Everyone gathered there for the wine and chatting. Very helpful desk staff, and umbrellas as we went out into the rain helped us feel prepared.
reviews.title: Value, location, coolness, service...

reviews.text: We would definitely return to this fun hotel with a great location.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: A green city, Portland should be proud of this hotel's policy of environment care.
reviews.title: Fun and great location

reviews.text: Everyone at Monaco seems happy and dedicated to service. We also stayed at The Nines in Portland, and frankly Monaco is a better value. Not that The Nines is a bad spot, just that Monaco has a cooler, more organic feel. The decor is eclectic, beds are very comfortable. The location is right downtown within walking distance of everything. We will stay there again.
reviews.title: Love the great location downtown with upscale quality & outstanding service!

reviews.text: We are a fan of the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore so we decided to try out the one in Portland. This hotel has amazing service (even better than in Baltimore, which was already superb), beautiful suites, and the New York Times (which was the cherry on top). Thank you for such an amazing experience. We will definitely stay there again the next time we visit Portland!
reviews.title: Amazing Stay

reviews.text: Have stayed several times for an on site meeting.
reviews.title: Consistent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Meeting food and service excellent.
reviews.title: Hotel Monaco
Love It!!
reviews.text: Hotel staff attentive and helpful.
Rooms top notch.
reviews.title: This is a Kimpton?!
Hated it
reviews.text: This is the worst hotel i have ever stayed at. paying this much for a hotel room you expect it to be high class with proffesion staff. they could not find our reservaton and made us wait in the lobby for 40 minutes and after they found it we were told they were out of the type of room we reserved and stuck us on a smaller room on a corner (tough luck mentality). there was no apology for the inconvenience and when i brought it up i was told " it was not our fault you made the reservation online" mind boggling right the next morning i complained to the manager and was told sorry for the inconveneince but there is nothing more i could do for you. I will never stay at this hotel again

We love this hotel!! We own a luxury hotel ourselves - so can be a bit of a snob when it comes to lodging. We have stayed at this location at least 15 times in the last 2 years. The location is perfect to just drop the car off to valet and walk to everything for the weekend. Portland City Grill is just 2 blocks away - and on the 30th floor of the us bank building - unbelievable view for dinner / drinks. The 5th Ave gets us back too because it is so close to the PC Grill!
reviews.title: Love it!!
I feel sorry for those who feel this place is top notch
reviews.text: I picked this hotel because of all the wonderful reviews. Whoa, was I in for a surprise. The room is DUSTY. There is dust everywhere including a line of dust where the carpet meets the wall. The carpet is stained. The room is really small, and we had a corner room.

reviews.title: Nice and Spacious Rooms
reviews.text: The style is terrible. Some kind of mesh between old-establishment elitist and old-fashioned. It's like walking into a country club in some hick, Midwestern town. You know.. prints, emboridery, heavy drapes, tassels. It's goshawful.

Okay, but moving on, their guest strategy is really tact-less. They leave a plush toy bear on your bed. Sounds cute, right? Only until you see the giant price tag hanging off its ear. The animal-print bathrobes really creeped me out. Animal print is not stylish. It's trashy!
reviews.title: Great downtown hotel
Excellent in many regards
reviews.text: Great location, staff that knows the meaning of "service" and impeccable rooms -- right down to the bathrobes in the closet, the Aveda products in the bathroom and the teddy bear on the bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was referred to by name no less than 3 times during my 2-night stay -- and not by the front desk either. The minibar stocker knew my name.
reviews.title: They get the details right.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their front desk staff is young, vibrant, smart, helpful and knowledgeable about the area.
reviews.title: Very Exquisite Hotel, be aware of CRIME in the AREA.

likes.disliked: — fact it is located near high drug area police do not make arrests here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spending three nights here in August, 2006 was one of the best decisions we made on our 10 day vacation to Portland and then the coast of Oregon. Arrival at the hotel via Max light rail from the airport was quick and easy. Staying carless is the best thing to do on a short trip to Portland. Check-in was a breeze. Courteous service at the front desk. We were given a room on the 8th floor facing a building which was being renovated. At first we thought noise from the construction would be a problem, but it wasn't. The suite was lovely with a luxurious King bed and a comfortable Queen pullout in the front room. The bathroom was nicely sized with great lighting and nice fixtures and supplies. Wi-Fi in the room worked perfectly, but the choices of televison channels was rather limited. Also old style 27" set in BR and small set in front room. I would expect HDTV flat screen from a hotel of this quality by now. Room service is from Red Star Tavern on the ground floor. Service was prompt and the food was pretty delicious. We also had breakfast in the Red Star one morning, and it too was excellent. Housekeeping did a fantastic job of keeping the place clean. Also great coffee in the lobby in the AM as well as some wine in the PM. Lobby was very comfortable place to catch up on the news from the complimentary assortment of newspapers and people watch. This place does most everything right, the details matter to them, and it shows.
reviews.title: Almost perfect

reviews.text: This is the nicest hotel in the downtown Portland area I imagine. The staff was super friendly and the hotel has a lot to offer. Good price for the area.
reviews.title: delightfully different

reviews.text: Had a very pleasant stay in a great location. Very nice room - clean and uniquely decorated. Appreciated valet parking and onsite restaurant and lounge. They have a daily wine reception, although we didn't participate because we had other plans. Spa next door. The hotel is a bit pricey but worth it once we booked at a discount. Signed up for Kimpton Rewards and had free internet plus $10 to use in lounge or for mini-bar.
reviews.title: Great stay at a great rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Monaco is perfectly located in the center of downtown -- Macy's, Nordstrom, Nike, Pioneer Square and excellent restaurants nearby. The service staff was knowledgeable, helpful; and friendly. Our room was spacious, well-appointed, and quiet. Parking was available under the hotel with professional; and friendly valets, but being downtown, pricey ($38 overnight). In light of reviews of the hotel's restaurant, we avoided it. One complaint -- the "happy hour" was disappointing to say the least -- very poor quality wine and goldfish crackers were it. Its sister hotel in Seattle does a much better spread.
reviews.title: Great location, great service, nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best hotel experiences we've had in a long time. We were able to check in early - on a Saturday no less - and were upgraded to suite which was an unexpected pleasant surprise. Staff from the reception desk, bell desk and in-room dining could not have been nicer, more genuine and willing to help. I can't remember the last time I stayed in a hotel where I felt that each staff member was not only invested in doing a good job but actually cared. Some went above and beyond and provided service as good as what you find at a Four Seasons or equivalent. Super-impressed. The room was perfect - spacious, clean, quiet, nicely decorated and comfortable. The location of the property was great for walking downtown. The in-room dining food was also good and reasonably priced compared to some other resorts I've been to. Overall - I would highly recommend Hotel Monaco and if we return to Portland, I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Excellent experience beginning to end

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights while touring west coast of America. The hotel is in a great location - easy to walk to restaurants, shops and other attractions. We were unfortunate with the weather while in Portland so it was lovely to have such a nice lounge to relax in. We got given a complimentary breakfast served in the room which was an added bonus. The 'drinks' hour in the lounge is a really nice idea and a lovely way to start the evening. The room was large - although ours - due to the shape was a little dark. However it was very comfortable and well appointed. The staff were friendly and helpful so would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel and excellent position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had lofty expectations with all of the favoarable reviews on this site and it did not disappoint. I mentioned to the valet that it was our 10 year anniversary and by the time we got back from lunch there was a bottle of champagne in the room. The bed was comfortable, the shower had twin heads and tons of water pressure, the room (910) had a good view and the decor was perfect for Portland. Location is good...walked to every meal. The room service food was delicious. Can't think of anything that could have been improved. Nice Work!
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a king deluxe room that was spacious and filled with nice romantic amenities such as animal-print bathrobes and Aveda toiletries. Although I stayed on Fourth of July night and the restaurant was closed, a Kimpton discount card was given for the inconvenience. The downtown location is just blocks from the Max train or Union Station and close to shopping and waterfront activities. Very comfortable beds and staff was friendly and accommodating. I would highly recommend this hotel. Also as a bonus you can receive Alaska Airline miles but you must mention your number at checkout.
reviews.title: All-Around Excellence

reviews.text: I lived in Portland for five happy years, so when it was time to go back after another 20 years, my first impulse was to find a small hotel or B&B in the neighborhoods to the east of the Willamette. I couldn't find any, but what I did find - the 5th Avenue Suites in the very heart of downtown Portland - was surprisingly nice.
reviews.title: Not Bad at All

reviews.text: From this hotel, it was easy to get to the best parts of Portland - you can walk to Powell's, the best bookstore on the planet; or to NW 21st, with amazing restaurants like Papa Haydn's. It's a few minutes to drive to Washington Park (don't walk, it's waay too big), maybe the best in-city park outside of New York. And if you want to see the real Portland - the wonderful, down-to-earth, head-screwed-on-right city of glorious underachievers - get out to those neighborhoods in SE and SW Portland. The valet parking in the hotel is efficient and friendly.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel with tons of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk is unfailingly perky (even when someone is giving an unnecessary lecture on the difference between a debit and a credit card). There's only one thing that kept me from giving this a full five stars:
reviews.title: Open Minded Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a non-smoking room. When we got there, we were greeted with the strong smell of cigarette smoke. The front desk (perkily) said it was indeed a non-smoking room - maybe the last guest had smoked against the rules? They kindly offered to move us to another room, which we took. Later, we learned from another hotel employee that we were in fact assigned a smoking room, that the hotel often puts non-smoking guests in smoking rooms when they're full.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service!

likes.disliked: — the bums all around the downtown area

reviews.title: We'd stay here again
reviews.text: Having never been to Portland, we didn't know whether to stay in the thick of downtown or on the edge and close to the river. We chose 'in the thick' and couldn't have been happier. Fifth Avenue Suites is close to just about everything you'd want to do downtown. We had a rental car, but you really don't need one with the excellent public transportation; and if you like to walk, everything is close by. You will pay about $20/day to park at any of the downtown hotels. Fifth Avenue Suites parking is excellent since you drop off and pick up your car in the garage and out of the elements. The staff is caring, friendly and efficient. We were pleased with our suite, which is definitely the way to go even for two people...much more room and two televisions. With so many hotels touting their brand of bed and bedding, all I can say is I loved my bed and have no idea what brand it was! The small stocked refrigerator can be used for your own items. We generally buy our own beverages and don't pay the high prices most hotels offer for theirs. The evening wine reception is a delight and reminiscent of a B & B gathering. It would be great if the hotel could add some cheese (Tillamook perhaps?) and crackers, since the push is on Oregon wines. I didn't expect a meal, but a tidbit would've been nice to go with the wine. There is an on-site business center, which we didn't use, but my husband did use the small workout facility and was pleased. All in all, we were delighted with this boutique style hotel. By the way, I appreciated not having to produce my AAA card (which I had) which I used to get a discounted rate. It's refreshing to be trusted. Some hotels actually want your AAA card number when you're booking online. Maybe it had something to do with Portland not being a 'hot ride' in rainy November.

reviews.title: An Excellent Hotel in downtown Portland !!!!
reviews.text: 5th Avenue Suites is one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed at - Bar none !!!

The service is impeccable without any criticism. From the bellman that brings in your bags to the valet to the front desk person to the wine hostess at the complimentary afternoon wine-tasting, everything was top-notch.
reviews.title: Superb service
Loved it
reviews.text: The room was a large two-room suite with a spacious living room & separate bedroom. Two TVs, Aveda amenities, magazines, welcome beverages(non-alcholic), 2 daily newspapers,etc.

reviews.title: Great place!
reviews.text: The hotel is well-postioned in the north downtown area that is within walking distances to some very good restaurants(We went to Mama Mia's - Italian & Typhoon - Thai). (I did not eat at the hotel restaurants.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for our first trip to Portland. Downtown location is great: in the middle of 2 great food truck pods, 2 blocks to the train to the airport, many places to eat all around it.
reviews.title: Amazing Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of this hotel, is the hotel. I've never stayed anywhere like this. The staff is the nicest staff I've ever encountered. The free happy hour in the lobby is great. They offer a selection of wine and beer. During the hour you can paint, meet other travelers, or just enjoy the beautiful lobby. We did all 3. The hotel also offers free bike rentals. They suggest a donation of $5 ($3 of which goes to charity), which we were more than happy to do. Anyone who has ever rented a bike knows that you can't do so for less that $30/day. We used the bikes to bike down to the waterfront park, down to china town, etc.
reviews.title: We are wowed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lastly, our housekeeper was unlike any other. She noticed that i had a lot of water bottles in the room and when I returned to the room she left me 3 bottles with a sweet little note.
reviews.title: Dog-friendly, right downtown!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is really long, so I'll stop here. But the BEST hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful introduction to Portland

reviews.text: We are Kimptom members (sign up before you go). We arrived before check in time (I think it was 2pm-ish), and our room was ready. We were upgraded to a premier suite (from a King Corner room) without asking, had a AAA package with free parking (which is usually $38/day so it was quite a savings), I used the secret word from Facebook (go to Facebook and check on the word) so they gave us $40 towards room service, we asked for our room goldfish for our stay, and off we went to our suite. The staff is super friendly and accommodating.
reviews.title: Fantastic service and character

reviews.text: My hubby and I have really fallen hard for the Kimpton group in recent times. This seems to be the only place that is pushing "customer service" still with their staff in a day and age when it really seems to be a dying art.
reviews.title: Cream of the Crop!
Perfect
reviews.text: We loved a few stays at a Kimpton in Philly and earlier this summer were needing to head up to Washington and found that we could stop at a selection of Kimptons in the Portland Area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried to book online, it said all 3 hotels were full. BUT, I remember the nice Concierge Lady from Philly who always said to call her for "anything!"...and so I did! I think I emailed her our dates and how we just needed one night in one of the 3 hotels if possible.
reviews.title: Boutique hotel in great location
great place to stay
reviews.text: What happened? I got a room and not just any room, a suite? and a goldfish friend for the stay and because we are members of their loyalty program we get $10 free credit to eat whatever in the mini bar. PLUS they gave us a bottle of wine and some local beers and there was even stuffed animal toys for our kids! OVER THE TOP Customer Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't believe it! They are so nice! From the guy who takes your car in the underground valet to the front desk, the guy who brought us fish food in the late night. LOL It's like they studied who's there and to know your names-yet totally left alone. Not annoying. When you wanted help they were there willing and able, just as it should be!
reviews.title: A First Rate Experience

reviews.text: We stayed there for 1.5 weeks, for business and for pleasure. Everything was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great charming hotel

reviews.text: The suite was big and yet cozy, decorating beautifully.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel - Suite

reviews.text: Everything was very comfortable and pleasuring.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Don't try anything else, we did and it was a waist of time and money comparing to this fibulas hotel.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: We loved the 5th Ave -- Had a horrid La Quinta experience in Walla Walla, WA an unexpected decent stay in Best Western in John Day, OR and then an "Ab Fab" stay in Portland, OR at the 5th Ave. Suites! (Then another disappointment at the Vintage Plaza - sigh.)
reviews.title: Top Notch Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived, the service was universally excellent - front desk staff, concierge, valet, doormen and housekeeping. Recommendations were provided with maps and everyone was willing to go out of their way to help. We received excellent advice on visiting breweries, breakfast locations, and biking.
reviews.title: Unparalleled service!

reviews.text: As with all Kimptons, Hotel Monaco Portland is pet friendly. They have a welcome sign in the lobby that names all the animals in residence - it was very cute. Also, the morning coffee/tea and evening wine reception is typical of all Kimptons - part of the reason we will always go out of our way to stay at one.
reviews.title: You want to stay at this hotel!

reviews.text: Other touches that were appreciated were the free Tuesday morning yoga and the Thursday morning run (although that one was too early for us to take advantage of).
reviews.title: Awesome Time
A Tired Hotel
reviews.text: Red Star was fantastic for breakfast - food was excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each room comes equipped with a yoga mat - loved having one provided so I didn't have to travel with mine.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service; Perfect Choice for Portland

reviews.text: I stayed in room 220 (156 dollars at AAA rate), which is a great corner room. This is an all-around great hotel, esp for a not-huge city like Portland. I would recommend it before the over-rated hotels in the city such as the Heathman, Bentson, and Governor, and then of course the run-of-the-mill Marriott and Hilton. To compare, all you have to do is visit one of the other hotels to appreciate how the Fifth Ave Suites excels in terms of consistently high service levels and room quality.
reviews.title: This is the best hotel in Portland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note that the name of the hotel changes to the Monaco on Feb. 16 2007 (I think). This is good because the old name makes it sound comparable to the Embassy Suites, which of course it is not. The latter is a mainstream hotel chain and not that good when you really think about it.
reviews.title: NOT at all what was expected!

likes.disliked: — Quality of the furniture, front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here are the hotel highlights as I see them:
reviews.title: Nice hotel, ongoing renovations

likes.disliked: — Small TV (will be addressed with renovation) and only 1 dresser drawer in room.

reviews.text: 1) Only two blocks from the central downtown area of Pioneer Square, which means it's not as noisy and swamped with tourists -- and thus a little more exclusive.
reviews.title: Fabulous 5th Avenue Suites

reviews.text: 2) EXCELLENT room service. Fast and friendly. Great food.
reviews.title: Super Hotel

likes.liked: — Luxuriously furnished rooms and competent, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located 2 blocks from the shopping area and 2 blocks from the tram tracks so very central and good to get around (which this is easy to do in Portland).
reviews.title: Great location & room
Loved the robes!
reviews.text: As soon as we arrived we were upgraded to a suite which meant we had a separate seating area and more space to put all of our stuff which was very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel decor was very nice as was pretty accurate from the pictures on the website. Despite this being a suite, the bathroom was of a standard size with I think is what let Kimpton hotels down, they should offer more rooms with free standing showers.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in a great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff were very hospitable and knowledgeable and good to talk to at the 5-6pm complimentary wine hour. However, the only downside to this was that if the hotel was hosting a conference, then delegates from the conference also joined in at the wine hour which meant there was very little room and the noise levels high so a bit harder to enjoy / relax when you are on holiday. However, this did not stop us from having a good stay at this hotel and the Kimpton chain is still one I look out for when I visit any US city.
reviews.title: Loved Everything About It

reviews.text: Great place to stay in downtown Portland. Service was great. Loved the decor and especially the "zebra and leopard" robes. Eclectic and a pleasant change from the institutional decor at most hotels. Great stay - highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Women's Weekend

reviews.text: We loved this hotel, loved the location in DT Portland. We walked the city and enjoyed getting to know the DT area. They had bikes you could use to get around also. Hotel Monaco was easy to find and has very friendly and helpful valet parking.
reviews.title: Beautiful Portland!

reviews.text: Loved the evening wine service. It was a birthday and they had a lovely bottle of Oregon wine and chocolates waiting for us. Very quiet also. We would definitely come back and stay here.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say enough about this hotel. We had a double room-which was spacious. It really was a suite. Had it's own sitting area with TV and phone, and another TV and phone in the bedroom area- this was divided by sliding doors. Place was immaculate. ALL staff were very friendly and super helpful and welcoming. Beds very comfortable and room was quite. Happy hour was a pleasant bonus. Location was great- easy access to waterfront and public transportation. This is the place to stay.
reviews.title: What a fabulous place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoy staying at hotel Monaco's along with Kimpton Inns. This hotel was wonderful, from the valet parking attendants who were super friendly and helpful to the front desk clerks. We had checked in and they upgraded us to a king suite at no charge, just because we were valued members. Our room had everything we had asked for along with a $15 voucher to the mini bar. We love staying there for it is pet friendly, along with their wine tastings at night time. All the staff were so friendly, along with accommodating to our needs. This hotel makes you feel like you are the only guest staying here not just credit card!
reviews.title: Beautiful and welcoming

reviews.text: First I have to say that I really love Monaco properties. But the Portland Hotel Monaco is outstanding, from its well trained, well-informed and friendly staff to the welcoming and comfortable lobby. We were very happy with our room, the evening wine service and the morning breakfast in the Red Star restaurant. Portland has a handful of first-rate hotels, but the Hotel Monaco stands out as a favorite.
reviews.title: Eclectic stay in an Eclectic city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was recently vacationing in Portland for a 3rd time and chose to stay at the Monaco again. As usual, very friendly staff always willing to assist with a smile on their face. The front desk, the bellman, the doorman, and even the valets are always willing to assist, give suggestions, and even engage in friendly conversation.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a large spacious room, which is unusual in a lot of city hotels. Room was divided between a bedroom and living room via sliding glass doors (pretty sure I had the same room on my last trip). On the clear days, I even had a great view of Mt. Hood in the distance.
reviews.title: Extra Mile!

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is great. Walking distance to plenty of food carts and tourist attractions, even the Pearl District isn't more than a 15 minute walk away. Voodoo Doughnut and stumptown coffee and just around the corner. Easy access to bridges and if you do decide to take day trips to places like Cannon Beach or Hood River, the valet stand has printed direction cards.
reviews.title: Very nice but not sure #1!

reviews.text: This was my first time back since the hotel was renovated and all they did was improve on a good thing. A few little things that keep my coming back to Kimpton is the free wine hour every evening. I also like how this hotel has the valet stand underground. When we arrived it was raining and it certainly is nice to be able to unload your bags someplace dry, which a lot of hotels in Portland do not offer. There are plenty of other high end hotels I could have chosen from in Portland, but I doub't they could compare to the Monaco.
reviews.title: Top quality hotel

reviews.text: This was our first stay at a Kimpton but it won't be the last. I cannot rave enough about the friendly helpful hotel staff! They were so helpful with directions, recommendations of restaurants and things to do, faxing and mailing. They were always smiling and seemed genuinely happy to help. The hotel itself was fun and exquisitely decorated. We found it incredibly clean. If I have one criticism it would be the need for bed pillows of different firmness types; they were a little firm for me, and they may have had them available -- I never asked. One great touch was the availability of bicycles for guest use, which was wonderful on a beautiful Portland Saturday! You will not be disappointed with your stay!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Very poor food choice

reviews.text: Because of the unusually hot weather (in the upper 90's), we stayed as close to the hotel as we could for meals. The first night we ate the hotel's own Red Star Tavern and Roast House, with eclectic decor and very comfortable seating. The menu is also eclectic and offers something for everyone. From The Gathered Greens to the wild Chinook Salmon, everything here reflects careful purchasing and preparation. The Plum Buckle was quite good and would have been even better had the weather been cooler. The Red Star (read "House") pinot noir was outstanding and a bargain at $8.50 for a generous 6 oz pour. The Heathman restaurant was also quite good but the air-conditioning had broken, given the historic nature of the building. The poor staff really suffered. The sea bass and sand dabs were good as was the shared berry salad. Excellent but pricey half bottle of Sancerre ($27) appeared after we were told it was gone. For our final night, we dined at the Typhoon restaurant nearby (this is a very popular chain). Brisk service made the fairly warm inside temperature bearable. Vietnamese and Thai food are offered here, but Shanghai vegetables sounds more Chinese! Very good but the Drunken Noodles suffered from too much sauce. Singha beer goes well with this type of food and certainly during the hot weather.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel

reviews.text: The Fifth Avenue Suites is really a perfect location as all the above restaurants are just steps away and the tram runs by the hotel entrance, although most depart from Pioneer Square, only two blocks away. Given the excellent service and comfortable lodgings, this hotel should be at the top of anyone's list. Just be sure NOT to get room #324!
reviews.title: Loved the 5th Avenue Suites

reviews.text: I spent a couple nights here with my parents in March. The suite was wonderful with a pull-out bed in a seperate room for me. There were two full bathrooms, one with a jacuzzi tub. The decor was a little over the top, but definately interesting. I loved the fitness facility. It was in a convenient location and was very large and well equipped for a hotel. You really cannot beat the location of the 5th Ave. Suites! I would not recommend bringing a car because the public transport is fantastic and the parking prices exorbitant. I did not get a chance to try out the restaurant, but did get to taste some wines and snacks in the lobby. I will definately stay here again with my boyfriend (and dog).
reviews.title: Nice place, a little cramped

reviews.text: While travelling, I found myself needing a hotel room for just one night in Portland, so I called AAA for hotel recommendations. They were great and gave me a list of the top 5 places with availability and rates. They told me the 5th Ave Suites had vacancies at $169., and since I had enjoyed a stay at the San Francisco Triton, I thought I'd give it a go.
reviews.title: Mixed Bag at 5Th Ave. Suites
In need of a refurbishment
reviews.text: I called the hotel, and the clerk was strangely hesitant; he seemed unsure as to exactly which rooms were vacant, and he balked at the quoted rate. He seemed to want me to book a suite at $220, which I did not want to do for just one night. Strangest of all, though, he seemed to be warning me that they were nearly booked up and they weren't sure if they would choose to honor my room request! In spite of my misgivings, I gave him my word I'd be there and he sort of promised me the deluxe room.

When we arrived, they had decided not only to honor us with a room but to upgrade us to a suite for the same price. Sounded great! That is, until we got to the suite. It reeked of smoke, and the phones smelled as though they had bin dipped in beer. We were exhausted, so we went for dinner at the excellent in-house restaurant and called it a night.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but lacked attention to details

reviews.text: Upon check-out, my partner mentioned the smelly room and was told we had indeed been put in a smoking room; they set some aside "for Europeans who insist on it". Hmm...last time I checked, I was neither from Europe or a smoker, so I would have appreciated being asked...or at least told.
reviews.title: Great people, great hotel!
Will make this our regular Portland hotel
reviews.text: Plusses: the hotel is quite attractive, and the room was large with a fairly good bed. The bathroom was large, although the fixtures were cheap...the shower massage was stuck on one setting and could not be budged. The restaurant was good, although on a busy Saturday night it was crammed with large groups of rowdy young people. Usually I would be bugged by that, but I was tired and hungry and the food was good. Service was pleasant but rather leisurely.
Not my first trip to Portland and this property, the service was great, rooms remodeled, and food at the Red Star was fantastic, worthy of several repeat stops during the trip!
reviews.title: Great stay at Monaco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel room remodel is great. Lots of outlets not he nightstands to plug in your iGadgets!
reviews.title: Hotel Monaco Portland delivers
Can't say enough good about this hotel.
reviews.text: Once again Kimpton lives up to their name. Great staff, excellent atmosphere and a must if you are traveling with your pet! The rooms have style, spotless and generally quite comfy. The only small complaint is that their beds are not as comfy as other hotel beds. I stay in a lot of hotels so I know. The most important piece of furniture in the room is the bed. I think Kimpton should look into buying the same or similar beds that are in Hilton Hotels. Nothing compares to those beds! Happy hour was great. More hotels should do this as it provides the opportunity for guests to mingle. And, pets are welcome to happy hour so a good time for all! This is definitely one of the top 5 hotels in Portland! Stay here and you won't be disappointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I realize that there are a lot of great reviews about this hotel, and they are all true, so I'll make this short. This was our first time in Portland and our first time staying at a Kimpton hotel. They had rose petals on the bed and a bottle of champagne waiting in the room when we checked in because my husband mentioned that it was my birthday. We took advantage of the free nightly wine tasting, the ice cream in the afternoon, the recommendations from the front desk and doorman on where to eat and the free bike rentals. All of the staff were fantastic, the place was spotless, great corner room, incredibly comfortable beds and pillows, and the room was very quiet. Worth every penny! I HIGHLY recommend it.
reviews.title: An outstanding choice for our Portland visit

reviews.text: The Hotel Monaco made our recent stay in Portland a visit we will always remember. From the moment you enter the hotel, you are greeted by an outstanding staff - including the dog concierge, Timmy. the decor of the hotel is fun and inviting -as well as luxurious. Our concierge, Tom, was so kind to made reservations for dinner, draw maps and diagrams of Portland, and recommend many great places to visit. We have never been treated as royally as we were at the Hotel Monaco.
reviews.title: A wonderful find in the City of Roses!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Monaco for four nights in June. I found the hotel to be fun, flirty and in a perfect location.
reviews.title: A treat for the senses. Love the Monaco

reviews.text: I'm in the "I love the decor" camp. I stayed in the king suite with the "flying bird" wall paper and the wonderful coral design carpet. The bravery of the design, the blending of the design elements, and the surprises around every corner had me laughing and throughly enjoying each and every element in the room. I felt like I was on a treasure hunt! I almost measured the "duck leg" lamp to see if it fit in my suitcase--but thought better of it : ) Oh, and the animal print robes are oversized and very plush. (I hate small the skimpy robes many hotels provide)
reviews.title: Great staff, idiosyncratic decor

reviews.text: With the exception of the one somewhat sullen young woman at the front desk who seems to be consistently dour to many guests (per reviews here), the staff was uniformly fabulous. The room service staff was particularly friendly and accommodating, and the doorman the friendliest I have encountered.
reviews.title: Beautiful boutique hotel!
Big bucks big disappointment
reviews.text: There is a highly dog-friendly attitude of the hotel, but the dogs are neither annoying or intrusive to non dog lovers. There is only one floor where dogs are allowed. I like dogs, but I have dog allergies, so I asked to be put on a floor that was dog free. There is also a hypo allergenic floor that is also gluten free (??), which I assume simply has a different wheat-free "honor basket".

I only made one afternoon wine reception, but enjoyed the one I attended. They are wonderfully friendly and engaging events. The wine is good (and free) and the hotel guests friendly. There is also free Ben and Jerry's ice cream and lemonade in the lobby in the afternoon. These events give the Monaco a nice vibe.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel right in the middle of town. Everything within an easy walk. It is an old hotel, but fully updated. Not cheap, but a fair price.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Best hotel experience to date
reviews.text: Room was very large and comfortable. Staff was terrific.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed four nights here and enjoyed it very much. The location is good for most things in the city center, the decor of the hotel is immaculate and stylish, particularly in the unique public lounge. This room was quite unique and a very comfortable place to sit with a drink or a book.
reviews.title: Great central hotel with superb decor

reviews.text: The welcome from staff was great, the service nearly all very good and fast.
reviews.title: Amazing - new favorite hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our suite was very spacious and well furnished. The living area was great and the bedroom comfortable, with a little screen between them.
reviews.title: A luxurious city center hotel with quality decor

reviews.text: Everything worked really well and the value for money was generally very good. Valet parking a touch expensive, but again very good service. Internet worked well.
reviews.title: Service and location!!

reviews.text: There is a happy hour every evening at which they give away drinks ( to everyone who walks in! ) so its popular. This creates a unique throng nightly where we got talking to a few people. Perhaps this is a Portland custom. Generally we were very happy and we'd come back if in Portland again.
reviews.title: So perfect!

reviews.text: Just a note regarding room sizes: queen deluxe rooms are not suites and are a bit small. Be sure to request a King Suite if you need a lot of extra room.
reviews.title: Nice, but we liked the Benson better
Great Service at a Nice Hotel
reviews.text: We usually stay at the Embassy Suites while in Portland, but for our most recent trip we decided to stay at the 5th Suites to save a little money. Overall, we found the reception area, staff, and location to be comprable to the Embassy Suites, valet parking was a breeze. Even wireless Internet is free compared to the Embassy Suites where they want to charge you $10.00 a day. The only complaint we would have is that our room was very cramped. We were only in Portland for a night, but if we'd been staying here for more than a few days and had a lot of luggage we probably would have started to feel claustrophobic in our room. The bottom line is that we saved about $60.00 over the Embassy Suites. While we liked the 5th Avenue Suites, the Embassy Suites is slightly more elegant and comes with a full breakfast and bigger rooms. On our next trip to Portland we'll have to carefully consider whether it's worth the savings to stay at the 5th Avenue Suites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stay at a Kimpton Hotel. The Monaco is a beautiful hotel in an excellent downtown location. The hotel service was outstanding. Our room was a first class corner room with a great view. The staff were friendly and professional. They took care of our needs and even took notice of our "Fifty" state completion. They directed us to sites and restaurants in the area. The doormen were helpful and the front desk staff were friendly at both check in and throughout our visit. The nightly wine/beer tasting was a treat. When we returned home, we noticed an error in a charge and after a short phone call the Management handled the situation in a professional manner and the situation was corrected. We would highly recommend the Monaco and would stay again if we were in the Portland area.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Portland

reviews.text: Had another great stay at Hotel Monaco. The staff helped me book 9 rooms for a mini-family reunion. As has been the case in past, the staff was great, the rooms beautiful and comfortable, the location is perfect. Morning coffee service, evening wine reception in their beautiful and comfortable lobby area.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel in downtown Portland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The attached restaurant was great as well, much nicer, better than a typical hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel experience

reviews.text: This is a truly great hotel.
reviews.title: Classic place, nice staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend.
reviews.title: These guys made our trip special...

description: The 4-diamond Hotel Monaco Portland, a Kimpton Hotel, offers an ideal sanctuary in downtown Portland, Oregon. Centered in the city’s cultural hub, this luxury hotel was named as one of the world’s Top 500 Hotels by Travel + Leisure magazine and is honored by TripAdvisor travelers as a Top 25 Hotel in the U.S. in 2012 (#9). Enter this unique boutique hotel and enter a world where everyone is warmly welcomed and pampered. Adjacent to the hotel is what some say is downtown Portland’s best restaurant, Red Star Tavern & Roast House.
